meta.name: MāyāLucIA
meta.description: A personal computational environment for scientific understanding through creation

bodies.label: MāyāLucIA
bodies.description: A personal computational environment for scientific understanding through creation.

facets.title: Core Cycle
facets.text: Measure → Model → Manifest → Evaluate → Refine. Starting from sparse measurements of natural systems, scientific models propagate constraints to reconstruct dense, self-consistent digital twins.

facets.title: The Sculptor
facets.text: Measurement is the raw material. Scientific models are the conceptual chisel. The digital twin is the revealed sculpture. The scientist sculpts — the agent assists, translates, and challenges.

facets.title: Markram's Hypothesis
facets.text: In any complex natural system, all parameters are interdependent. A few anchor measurements implicitly constrain the rest — provided you have the right models to capture the interdependencies.

facets.title: Brain Circuits
facets.text: Reconstructing cortical microcircuits from sparse morphological and connectivity data. Building on Blue Brain / Open Brain Institute methodology.

facets.title: Mountain Valleys
facets.text: Digital twins of Himalayan landscapes integrating geology, hydrology, ecology, and human impact. The Parvati Valley as first case study.

facets.title: The Feynman Imperative
facets.text: What I cannot create, I do not understand. Understanding emerges through the act of building — not observing, not consuming, but reconstructing from first principles.

facets.title: Domains
facets.text: Brain circuits, mountain valleys, protein dynamics, quantum sensors — each domain drives development of shared infrastructure while remaining scientifically autonomous.

facets.title: Architecture
facets.text: Eight planned modules: MāyāCore, MāyāDana, MāyāKalpa, MāyāNāṭya, Sūtra, Śāstra, Tīrtha, Dhyāna — mapping onto the Measure-Model-Manifest-Evaluate cycle.

bodies.label: MāyāPortal
bodies.description: Visual synthesis kernel. C++23 rendering engine built on SDL3 and WebGPU.

facets.title: Architecture
facets.text: Pure core / effectful shell. Physics and geometry computations are pure functions; platform interaction (windowing, GPU) lives at the shell boundary.

facets.title: Stack
facets.text: C++23 with wgpu-native for cross-platform GPU abstraction. SDL3 for windowing and input. CMake build system with FetchContent for dependencies.

facets.title: Literate Source
facets.text: Source of truth lives in org-mode files under codev/. Code is tangled from prose — the narrative is the specification. Never edit generated source directly.

facets.title: Role
facets.text: The manifestation layer — where digital twins become visible, audible, tangible. MāyāNāṭya's rendering kernel, the first concrete module implementation.

facets.title: WebGPU
facets.text: Using wgpu-native rather than browser WebGPU. Cross-platform from day one: Linux, macOS, Windows, and eventually web via wasm.

facets.title: Current State
facets.text: Active development. Basic rendering pipeline functional. Literate source structure established in codev/. Wireframe and flat-shaded polytope rendering working.

bodies.label: MāyāJīva
bodies.description: Magnetic bug simulation. Emergent collective behaviour from simple local rules.

facets.title: Core Design
facets.text: Header-only C++ core in src/core/, namespace mayajiva. Templated on N_CHANNELS for compile-time channel count. Zero runtime overhead for channel selection.

facets.title: Emergence
facets.text: Simple local rules — magnetic alignment, nearest-neighbour interaction — produce collective behaviour: flocking, vortices, phase transitions. The whole exceeds the sum.

facets.title: Validation
facets.text: 23 tests passing. Python generates reference JSON, Catch2 tests compare C++ output. Cross-language validation ensures the physics is right.

facets.title: Godot Integration
facets.text: GDExtension binding for Godot 4. Real-time visualization of emergent swarm dynamics. The simulation core remains pure; Godot is the shell.

facets.title: Build
facets.text: CMake with FetchContent for Catch2 v3.5.2 and nlohmann/json v3.11.3. GCC 11.4.0, C++20 standard.

facets.title: Inspiration
facets.text: Magnetic bugs as a minimal model of collective intelligence. From statistical mechanics to swarm behaviour — the interacting particle systems that drive MāyāLucIA's philosophy.

bodies.label: Bravli
bodies.description: Brain building toolkit. 293 tests covering neurons, networks, synapses, neuromodulation.

facets.title: Scope
facets.text: LIF and AdEx neurons, Brunel networks, stochastic synapses, neuromodulation, mushroom body dynamics. A comprehensive toolkit for computational neuroscience.

facets.title: Validation
facets.text: 293 tests verified. First manuscript checked against simulation output. Every claim in the paper backed by reproducible code.

facets.title: Methodology
facets.text: Built on Blue Brain / Open Brain Institute methodology. Sparse morphological and connectivity data propagated through biophysical models to reconstruct dense microcircuits.

facets.title: Architecture
facets.text: Pure numerical core with clean separation of neuron models, network topology, and simulation engine. Errors as values, not exceptions.

facets.title: Brunel Networks
facets.text: Balanced excitation-inhibition networks exhibiting asynchronous irregular firing. The canonical model of cortical dynamics, implemented and validated.

facets.title: Mushroom Body
facets.text: Insect olfactory learning circuit. Sparse coding, Kenyon cells, lateral inhibition. A minimal circuit for understanding associative memory.

bodies.label: MāyāPramāṇa
bodies.description: Universal quantum sensor controller — digital twins of quantum sensors.

facets.title: Trilingual
facets.text: Python for exploration, Haskell for specification, C++ for deployment. Each language plays to its strength. Cross-language validation ensures consistency.

facets.title: For Saikat
facets.text: Built for Dr. Saikat Ghosh, IIT Kanpur — quantum measurement expert and founder of Qmet Tech. The invitation leads with git clone and a live demo.

facets.title: Architecture
facets.text: Pure core / effectful shell with monadic composition. Physics is pure functions; hardware interaction at the boundary. FP grammar throughout.

facets.title: Bloch Equations
facets.text: Lesson 00: the hello world of quantum sensing. RK4 integrator, T1/T2 relaxation, Rabi oscillation — the foundation everything else builds on.

facets.title: MāyāLoom
facets.text: First project to use cadenza-annotated literate documents. Loom manifests declare concepts, prerequisites, anti-targets. Knowledge weaving made concrete.

facets.title: Vision
facets.text: Every quantum sensor — NV centres, atomic clocks, magnetometers — as a digital twin. Simulate before you measure. Understand before you build.

facets.title: The Sculptor's Paradox
facets.text: The tool that offers no resistance teaches nothing. Push back on flawed reasoning. Offer alternatives. The collaboration needs friction — and the friction between human and machine is where understanding lives.

facets.title: Measure → Manifest
facets.text: The core cycle: Measure, Model, Manifest, Evaluate, Refine. Sparse observations become dense digital twins through scientific models that propagate constraints.

facets.title: Epistemic Hygiene
facets.text: Separate what is known from what is inferred from what is speculated. Use calibrated language. No false confidence, no sycophancy, no papering over uncertainty with fluent prose.

facets.title: Markram's Bet
facets.text: All parameters in a complex natural system are interdependent. A few anchor measurements implicitly constrain the rest. This is the radical hypothesis that drives the reconstructive approach.

facets.title: Neither Subordinate
facets.text: Human and machine as complementary intelligences. The human contributes embodied intuition and judgment; the machine contributes rapid traversal of conceptual space and tireless attention to detail.

facets.title: Constant Seeking
facets.text: Treat every input as creative direction for a joint pilgrimage of understanding. The artifact is a byproduct, not the purpose. Linger in the question before converging on an answer.

bodies.label: MāyāDevGenī
bodies.description: Human-machine collaboration framework. The art of productive friction.

facets.title: Origin
facets.text: Born from the recognition that AI collaboration requires a methodology — not just prompts, but shared principles, epistemic standards, and creative tension.

facets.title: Productive Friction
facets.text: The tool that offers no resistance teaches nothing. DevGenī encodes the rules of engagement: when to push back, when to defer, when to linger in ambiguity.

facets.title: Calibrated Language
facets.text: Known, inferred, speculated — always marked. Confidence levels explicit. No fluent prose masking uncertainty. The methodology demands honesty from both sides.

facets.title: Spawns MāyāLoom
facets.text: DevGenī's collaboration principles gave birth to MāyāLoom — the cadenza system for annotating knowledge. Method begets infrastructure.

facets.title: Plan + Spec
facets.text: Every collaboration produces two artifacts: plan.org (why, human-facing, authoritative) and spec.org (what, machine-facing, derived). If they disagree, the plan wins.

facets.title: The Human Side
facets.text: PhD physicist, 20 years across academia and industry. Interacting particle systems, stochastic processes, computational neuroscience. Works from Emacs with org-babel.

bodies.label: MāyāLoom
bodies.description: Tānā-bānā — the warp and weft of human-machine understanding.

facets.title: Kabir's Weaving
facets.text: Named for the weaver-saint's loom. Tānā (warp) is structure; bānā (weft) is narrative. Knowledge emerges where they cross — neither thread alone makes cloth.

facets.title: Cadenza
facets.text: Six fields per cadenza: :concept, :level, :prereqs, :assumes, :anti-targets, :connects-to. A musical term — the soloist's improvisation within the orchestra's structure.

facets.title: Loom Manifest
facets.text: #+LOOM:, #+DEFINES:, #+DEPENDS:, #+EXPORTS:, #+CADENZAS: — org-mode headers that declare what a document teaches, needs, and connects to.

facets.title: Validated
facets.text: Cycle 1 complete. A fresh agent parsed the manifest, found the cadenza, generated a correct tutorial. The format works — machine-readable knowledge weaving.

facets.title: Three Agreements
facets.text: Human writes the structure. Machine reads the annotations. Both honour the contracts. The loom works only when both sides hold their threads taut.

facets.title: Next
facets.text: Human reading pass, test remaining cadenzas, annotate future lessons across MāyāPramāṇa and beyond. The loom is built; now we weave.

bodies.label: WebGPU
bodies.description: wgpu-native rendering backend. Cross-platform GPU abstraction.

facets.title: Why wgpu
facets.text: Cross-platform from day one. One API for Vulkan, Metal, DX12, and eventually WebGPU in the browser.

facets.title: Native Path
facets.text: Using wgpu-native C bindings rather than browser WebGPU. Desktop-first, web later via wasm compilation.

facets.title: Pipeline
facets.text: Render pipeline, compute shaders, buffer management — all through wgpu's safe abstraction over platform-specific GPU APIs.

bodies.label: SDL3
bodies.description: SDL3 windowing and input. Platform layer for MāyāPortal.

facets.title: Platform Layer
facets.text: SDL3 handles windowing, input events, and platform abstraction. The shell boundary — everything outside is pure.

facets.title: SDL3 vs SDL2
facets.text: SDL3 brings a modernized API, better GPU integration, and improved event handling. Worth the migration from SDL2.

facets.title: Input
facets.text: Keyboard, mouse, gamepad — unified input handling. The bridge between human intention and digital twin interaction.

bodies.label: Literate Source
bodies.description: Org-mode literate source in codev/. The narrative is the specification.

facets.title: Why Literate
facets.text: Code tangled from prose. The reasoning lives alongside the implementation. You read a story; the compiler reads instructions. Same source, two audiences.

facets.title: Org-Babel
facets.text: Emacs org-babel tangles code blocks into source files. The .org file is authoritative; generated .cpp and .h are derived artifacts.

facets.title: codev/
facets.text: All literate source lives under codev/. Each org file covers a coherent module or subsystem. The directory structure mirrors the architecture.

bodies.label: C++ Core
bodies.description: Header-only C++ simulation core. Templated on N_CHANNELS.

facets.title: Header-Only
facets.text: The entire simulation core is header-only. Include and use — no separate compilation step. Templates resolve at compile time.

facets.title: N_CHANNELS
facets.text: Templated on channel count. Compile-time polymorphism — no virtual dispatch, no runtime overhead for channel selection.

facets.title: Pure Core
facets.text: No I/O, no side effects. Pure functions that take state and return new state. The shell (Godot, tests) handles all effectful operations.

bodies.label: Godot Extension
bodies.description: GDExtension binding for Godot 4. Real-time swarm visualization.

facets.title: GDExtension
facets.text: Godot 4's native extension system. C++ simulation core exposed to Godot's scene tree without going through GDScript.

facets.title: Real-Time
facets.text: Thousands of magnetic bugs rendered and simulated at interactive frame rates. The swarm emerges before your eyes.

facets.title: Shell Layer
facets.text: Godot is the effectful shell around the pure simulation core. Rendering, input, scene management — all at the boundary.

bodies.label: Bloch Equations
bodies.description: Lesson 00. The hello world of quantum sensing.

facets.title: The Equations
facets.text: dM/dt = γ(M × B) − relaxation. Three coupled ODEs describing spin precession in a magnetic field with T1 and T2 decay.

facets.title: RK4 Integrator
facets.text: Fourth-order Runge-Kutta integration. Stable, accurate, and simple enough to implement in all three languages for cross-validation.

facets.title: Rabi Oscillation
facets.text: Apply a resonant RF field and watch the magnetization vector nutate between up and down. The fundamental operation of quantum measurement.

facets.title: Relaxation
facets.text: T1 (longitudinal) and T2 (transverse) relaxation. The spin system's return to equilibrium — different timescales, different physics, both essential.

bodies.label: Interactive Demo
bodies.description: Self-contained HTML demo. The invitation to collaborators.

facets.title: 3D Bloch Sphere
facets.text: WebGL-rendered Bloch sphere with real-time magnetization vector. Watch the spin precess, nutate, and relax in three dimensions.

facets.title: Live Controls
facets.text: Sliders for B0 field strength, RF amplitude, T1/T2 relaxation times, and detuning. Presets for common experiments. Immediate visual feedback.

facets.title: Self-Contained
facets.text: Single HTML file, no build step, no dependencies beyond Three.js CDN. Clone the repo and open in a browser. The lowest possible barrier to entry.
